examples: The Pope in sending Relicks to Princes, does as Wenches do by their Wassels at New-years-tide, they present you with a Cup, and you must drink of a slabby stuff; but the meaning is, you must give them Moneys, ten times more than it is worth.
To Virgo, Leo turnes the time, and in a reaking sweate.
He buskling vp his burning Mane, doth dry the dropping south.
And swallowes vp the slabby cloudes in fyry foming mouth.

description: slab (“solid object that is large and flat”) +‎ -y

entries.meaning: Composed of slabs; resembling a slab or slabs; inelegant, cumbersome, clunky.
examples: Then he set up another shop an’ hired some of us ’round here to go an’ make them big, slabby art-chairs.

entries.meaning: (New Zealand, informal) A worker who deals with timber in the form of slabs.
examples: The employer shall supply the sawyer and tailer-out at breast bench, workers operating goose-saws, and slabbies with suitable leather aprons for use while so employed. When requested by the worker a suitable apron shall be supplied to timber stackers, lorry drivers, and machinists.
